content.description:
The Trojans in the Court of Dido

Nos Troia antiqua, si vestras forte per aures
Troiae nomen iit, diversadiversus, -a, -um, adj. = varius, -a, -um per aequora vectosveho, -ere, vexi, vectum = porto, -are 
forte sua LibycisLibycus, -a, -um, adj.: of Libya (area in north Africa that contains the city of Carthage) tempestas appulitappello, -ere, -puli (+ dat.): to drive to  oris.
content.question: In the passage, Aeneas is explaining why his people

choices.label: suffered during the fall of Troy

unit.text: 6: Course Project and Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry
